panel.field:
Replaces NPC039 "Cocktail Sign" and NPC228 "Droll"
Adds Track NPCs that control the movement of other NPCs, as well as semisolid platforms that are normally immobile, but can be moved by tracks.
Track ID: 228, Platform ID: 039

The platforms will only be solid while Quote is slightly above it, meaning that it can be jumped through. They are normally 2 blocks wide, but can be adjusted to a length of 3 tiles by using the 0x1000 flag, or a direction of 2.
The Track NPC will search for all NPCs that have eventnums 1 greater than its own eventnum, and attach them to itself.
Lower byte in the flag ID represents the radius of the shape, in 1/8 tiles. (0~255) Higher byte in the flag ID represents the movement speed of the track, in 1/8192 revolutions per frame. (0~255)
For example, if you wanted a radius of 6 tiles and a speed of 1 rotation per 10 seconds, you'd have a flagID of: (6*8) + 256*int(1/10*8192/50) = 48 + 4096 = 4144.

The platforms' sprites will be from (192,240) to (223,255) for the small platforms, and (224,240) to (271,255) for large platforms. The sprites for the connecting NPCs will be from 128,144 to 143,159. These will only be visible if the "connected" flag is set. It is recommended to use NpcSym.pbm for these sprites, as there is empty space suitable. The "linked" flag is supposed to trace the shape of the track, but is currently not functional.

Use the <ANP command to customize the track shape, as well as tilting/stretching the shape. <ANPXXXX,AAAA,BBBB, where AAAA is the shape, BBBB is the shape's modifiers. Note: You must wait at least 1 frame after the NPC is initialized, before using <ANP, otherwise it will reset the stretch_angle value to the default of 32 (1:1 aspect ratio)
Allowed shapes: 0000 = circle, 0001 = square, 001X = X amount of loops, 002X = X amount of orbits.
For the modifier BBBB, this should be 256*stretch_angle + rotation_angle.
The stretch_angle should be equal to atan(aspectRatio), meaning that values like 0 and infinity can be represented in the aspect ratio, resulting in a flat line.
For example, if you wanted a rectangle tilted 15 degrees to the left, and with an aspect ratio of 1:2, the modifier would be: (15/360*256) + 256*int(atan(1/2)/360*256) = 11 + 4864 = 4875. "<ANPXXXX,0001,4875"
If you wanted a shape of 3 loops arranged in an equilateral triangle shape, with the whole thing tilted 70 degrees, you'd have: (70/360*256) + 256*int(atan(1))/360*256) = 50 + 8192 = 8242. "<ANPXXXX,0013,8242"
0x0002 = "connected" (connects all NPCs to itself with NPC039)
0x0004 = "linked" (creates a shape of the track using NPC039, currently unimplemented)
0x0400 = "hard" (completely nullifies any of the NPC's own movement, drags NPC with much higher priority (including through walls)
0x2000 = "hyperspeed" (track rotates 32 times as fast, recommended to combine with flag 0x0400 to prevent the NPC not being able to catch up with the sudden movement)
